collection.title: CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing efficiency in human T cells using novel guide RNA designs
collection.authors: Smith, J; Jones, A; Williams, B; Chen, C; Davis, D
collection.abstract: We present a novel approach to CRISPR gene editing that significantly improves efficiency in human T cells. Our guide RNA design strategy achieves 95% editing efficiency while maintaining low off-target effects. This has implications for cell therapy and gene therapy applications.

collection.title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals heterogeneity in CRISPR-edited cell populations
collection.authors: Garcia, M; Lee, K; Patel, R
collection.abstract: Using single-cell RNA sequencing, we characterized the transcriptomic landscape of CRISPR-edited cell populations. Our analysis reveals significant heterogeneity in editing outcomes and identifies molecular markers that predict editing success.

collection.title: Computational modeling of protein folding dynamics in aqueous solutions
collection.abstract: We developed a new computational framework for modeling protein folding dynamics. Our approach combines molecular dynamics simulations with machine learning to predict folding pathways with high accuracy.
